About

I am a self-taught painter and audio-engineer, but these days, I spend most of my time coding. My journey into software development stems from a fascination with bridging technology and fine art while preserving artistic authenticity. The problem-solving skills I've developed through years of creative work give me a unique perspective in tackling complex challenges. I look forward to working and evolving in the field of tech because technology is constantly changing; and like change, growth is also constant.

Experience

2024 - present

Full Stack Developer ⋅ codeDifferently

During my time at codeDifferently I learned how to build real world applications using an accelerated SPRINT method. Some of the applications I built include CSV parsers, bank atm features, simple grade checkers, an interactive game called numMeCrazy and much more. In addition to learning how to learn in an efficient manner, I was able to obtain another valuable skill; namely, how to optimize my learning process in group settings through collaborative learning. With a collective approach to abstracting complex concepts I was able to not only help myself, but my team members as well. Working in a collaborative environment also enhanced my soft skills.

Java

JavaScript

TypeScript

React.JS

Spring

2022 - 2024

Audio Engineer ⋅ FreeLance

I stumbled into the audio sector because the opportunity presented itself, and I picked up the trade pretty quickly. I began my audio journey as a studio intern at Manhattan Beach Recordings. After a six-month tenure there, I began to work independently, mainly in live sound at several local bars in the Brooklyn area. In addition to live sound work, I ran a plethora of vocal tracking, mixing, and song-writing sessions for various artists; most notably, Wale, DreamDoll, Playboi Carti, Jada Kingdom, and Skepta. As an audio engineer, I had to work in rapidly changing environments all the time, which allowed me to better hone my adaptive skillset. Working with electrical circuitry was a significant part of my work; from repairing tweeters, replacing transducers in microphones, replacing circuit boards on mixing consoles, soldering damaged wires and much more. Here is a list of studios I've worked in: Manhattan Beach Recordings, Quad Studios, Power Station at BerkleeNYC, Platinum Sound Recordings, and Jungle City Studios.

Logic Pro

Pro Tools

FL Studio

Ableton Live

SSL L series, Avid S6L, API 1608-II mixing consoles.

Various compressors; including, Tubtech's CL 1B and DBX's 160A hardware compressors.

2022 - 2022 (4 months)

Jeweler/Stone-Setting Apprentice ⋅ Riva Precision

As an entry-level jeweler/setter at Riva, I had to learn to read blueprints and implement them into actual pieces. I was able to employ and further improve upon my quick problem-solving skills due to the tedious, hurried nature of the work. While at Riva, I produced over 350 pieces for production (retail). Working as a jeweler in a factory was extremely challenging; due to the fast working pace and high-quality standard, but it's where I discovered my love for problem-solving.

Diamond Drill, and graver (specific to situation) competency.

Loupe (microscope) proficiency.

Pave, and prong pusher experience.

Polishing, buffering, and ultrasonic cleaning knowledge.

View Full Resume

Projects

Scientific Calculator ⋅ Java

Project Summary: I developed a robust scientific calculator application in Java that operates through the CLI. The project showcases clean object-oriented design principles and includes advanced mathematical operations beyond basic arithmetic. I implemented a custom parser for handling complex mathematical expressions and utilized JUnit for comprehensive testing. To ensure easy deployment, I configured Gradle build automation, allowing users to run the calculator via a simple JAR file. This project demonstrates my ability to create practical, user-friendly tools while maintaining code quality and deployment efficiency. Calculator
